CatDescriptText: Marlene Marks, student, Harwick and Joseph Sallows, retired, Oakland were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe the people who vote only for the President every four years make the best citizens?"  Ms. Marks' answer reads "No, because the voter will not have information on the other office holders.  The people who vote in each election have a better knowledge of the candidates." Mr. Sallows' answer reads: "Not a good citizen. You should vote in every election."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Marlene Marks wearing light colored hat with feather and flecked coat with dark buttons, standing in front of block wall, Downtown; Portrait of Joseph Sallows wearing dark fedora, eyeglasses, and dark overcoat, standing in front of block wall, Downtown
